description: The Holland Hotel on West 42d Street, which houses 272 homeless families, has almost 1,000 violations of the health, building and housing codes, city officials said yesterday.

title: BLAIR, JOHN & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including tax credits of $4,551,000 for the quarter and $16,701,000 for the 9 months, a charge of $880,000 for the quarter and 9 months associated with the sublease of space at the company's New York location and a loss of $1.8 million for the 9 months in connection with the discontinuance of fulfillment-advertising operations. c-Net income.

title: KNICKS UPHELD IN EFFORT TO ACQUIRE ALBERT KING
description: The Knicks had their first victory of the season yesterday and it did not come on the basketball court. Instead, it came 3,000 miles away in London.

title: Argentine Debt Talks
description: David Mulford, an Assistant Treasury Secretary, will fly to Argentina Tuesday for talks on the United States debt strategy with President Raul Alfonsin and Finance Ministry officials, a Treasury spokesman said today.

title: Family Interests
description: President Reagan's tax reform plan is pro-family, the White House boasts. It would raise one's personal exemption, for instance, and let working couples sock away more savings for their retirement in tax-deferred accounts.

title: Careers;   Need Seen For Quake Engineers
description: THE devastating earthquake in Mexico and recent tremors in the New York-New Jersey area have put a new emphasis on an old subject - earthquake engineering.

title: THEATER: 'THE SPECIAL,' AT JEWISH REPERTORY
description: GALT MACDERMOT'S melodic flow continues unabated in ''The Special,'' his new musical at the Jewish Repertory Theater. But isn't the composer of ''Hair'' and ''The Human Comedy'' being a bit promiscuous with his talent? To call ''The Special'' a trivial evening is to overdramatize its achievements. This is a show named after a delicatessen sandwich, and, given the hamminess of the cast, one can't even state with certainty that the deli is strictly kosher.

title: DATACOPY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Three Mafia Trials Under One Roof
description: Three trials involving organized-crime suspects are under way in the same Federal courthouse on Foley Square in lower Manhattan. The three are: THE ''PIZZA'' TRIAL.

title: EFFORT GROWS TO RESTRAIN SOVIET SHIP IN U.S.
description: South Africa said today that foreign television networks were helping to undermine peace in the country. Meanwhile, a leading local newspaper openly broke the law by publishing an interview with the banned guerrilla leader, Oliver Tambo.

title: GAPS IN COMMAND AT FIRE SITE ARE DEPICTED IN PHILADELPHIA
description: As hearings continue on the May 13 battle between the city police and the radical group Move, a common thread winds through top officials' often contradictory testimony: lack of communication.

title: SOUTH AFRICA RADIO CHARGES DISTORTIONS BY FOREIGN PRESS
description: South Africa said today that foreign television networks were helping to undermine peace in the country. Meanwhile, a leading local newspaper openly broke the law by publishing an interview with the banned guerrilla leader, Oliver Tambo.

title: 2 KILLED AND 12 HURT AS CAB RACES OUT OF CONTROL
description: Two people were killed and 12 others were injured when a taxicab went out of control during a robbery attempt late Sunday and crashed into two cars in Brooklyn, the police said yesterday.

title: Thanks, Guys
description: Coach John Robinson talks to some Los Angeles sportswriters about press criticism that the Rams have received despite their 8-1 record: ''We don't want to get overenthusiastic, and we appreciate the help you have given us.''

title: TUESDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Nets vs. Washington Bullets, at Byrne Meadowlands Arena, 7:30 P.M. The Nets won four of the six games between the teams last year and finished two games ahead of the Bullets in the Atlantic Division standing. (Television -SportsChannel, 11:45 P.M. tape. Radio - WNBC, 660; 7:30 P.M. live). Knicks vs. SuperSonics, at Seattle, 10:30 P.M. The Knicks wrap up their five-game road trip tonight. They will be back home against the Milwaukee Bucks Thursday (Television - MSG, 10:30 P.M. Radio - WNBC, 660; 10:20 P.M.) Rockets vs. Portland Trail Blazers, at Houston (Television - WTBS, 8 P.M.) Boxing Darryl Fuller, champion, vs. Gary Hinton, at Atlantic City, Sands Hotel and Casino, 12 rounds, for the World Boxing Council Continental Americas junior welterweight title. First preliminary, 8 P.M. Although Hinton is the United States Boxing Association champion, his title will not be at stake. If he wins, however, his title will be declared vacant and the two leading contenders will fight for it. The 24-year-old Fuller, from Jackson, Tenn., won his title March 21 by knocking out Kel Robin in 11 rounds in Las Vegas. Tim Broady vs. Tim Williams, at Atlantic City, Tropicana Hotel and Casino, 10 rounds, supermiddleweights. First preliminary, 7:30 P.M. Hockey Islanders vs. Calgary Flames, at Nassau Coliseum, Uniondale, L.I., 8:05 P.M. The Flames won two of the three games played against the Islanders last season, and Rejean Lemelin was victorious in goal both times.

title: School Bus Seat Belts
description: To the Editor:

title: Giants Unsure on Next Kicker
description: The Giants' place-kicker for next Sunday's game here against the Los Angeles Rams will be . . . .

title: Quivar Cancels Concert
description: The mezzo-soprano Florence Quivar, who was to have sung Berlioz's ''Mort de Cleopatre'' with the Orchestre de la Suisse Romande on Thursday at Carnegie Hall, has canceled her appearance because of illness. ''Bacchus et Ariane,'' an orchestral composition by Roussel, will replace the Berlioz vocal work on the program conducted by Armin Jordan.

title: CITY GAS CO OF FLORIDA reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
P.& G. GETS KEY LINES OF SEARLE
description: The Procter & Gamble Company agreed today to acquire two of the nation's leading over-the-counter drug products from G.D. Searle & Company. They are the nation's top-selling laxative, Metamucil, and the nation's leading motion sickness medicine, Dramamine.

title: REGULATOR CONTINUING EXTRA FEE
description: The Federal Home Loan Bank Board will continue an extra $1 billion-a-year assessment on the thrift industry for the next three to five years, a senior bank board official said today.

title: SAFETY PANEL MEMBERS FAULT N.R.C. INDIAN POINT STANCE
description: Five members of a Nuclear Regulatory Commission advisory committee have criticized the commission's decision to allow the Indian Point reactors in Westchester County to continue operating without safety improvements.

title: OIL-RICH LAND IS SEARCHED FOR WATER
description: LIBYA, awash in oil but short of fresh water, has begun an ambitious civil engineering project to mine ancient water trapped in a sub-Saharan aquifer. The North African country plans eventually to lay 2,500 miles of pipeline at a cost of $25 billion to carry more than 200 million cubic feet of water a day to farms and cities along the inhabited coastal region.

title: AFA PROTECTIVE SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Aircraft Carrier Hits Reef
description: The nuclear aircraft carrier Enterprise struck a reef off San Clemente Island that tore a hole in her hull but the ship will continue her cruise, the Navy said today. The 1,100-foot Enterprise hit a submerged object Saturday night about 100 miles off San Diego, said Senior Chief Petty Officer Fred Larsen, a spokesman for the Pacific Fleet air forces.

title: SOUTHLAND REBUFFS BURLINGTON
description: The Southland Royalty Company's directors yesterday unanimously rejected a $695 million tender offer made by Burlington Northern Inc. two weeks ago.

title: Dallas Offering School Bonds
description: The Dallas Independent School District is offering $153.8 million of unlimited tax bonds to refund outstanding debt. Underwriters are led by Merrill Lynch Capital Markets.

title: AMERICANS AND ROYALTY: SYMBOLS CLASH NO MORE
description: The imminent visit of a young British couple, he 36 years old, she 24, has sent a frisson of excitement through Washington unmatched in the memory of old-timers in a city quite accustomed to receiving the glamorous and the celebrated.

title: New Brain Test For Combat Flying
description: A researcher says he has developed a neuropsychological test to identify candidates for Navy combat flying who are likely to be unsuitable because their brains have trouble perceiving spatial relationships.

title: CAPITAL SOUTHWEST CORP reports earnings for As of Sept 30
description: Asset figures represent net assets.

title: RECITAL: ALEXIS WEISSENBERG
description: LIKE him or not, Alexis Weissenberg is one of our era's more original pianists, and he was at his best Saturday night at the 92d Street Y, at Lexington Avenue.

title: Police Thwart Students At a U.S. Office in Seoul
description: Police officers overpowered 14 South Korean students and freed three hostages today after the students had occupied the American Chamber of Commerce office in Seoul for two hours.

title: HAROLD C. MEYERS, EX-HEAD OF THE AUTO CLUB OF NEW YORK
description: Harold C. Meyers, retired president of the Automobile Club of New York and a developer of a widely used rehabilitation program for drunken drivers, died at the White Plains Medical Center last Wednesday. He was 70 years old and lived in Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Soviet Men Lead In Gymnastics
description: The Soviet Union took the lead tonight in the men's team standing at the World Gymnastics Championships.

title: South Africa Not Alone in Discrimination Policy
description: To the Editor:

title: INTER-CITY GAS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Court Refuses to Review Movie Antitrust Ruling
description: The Supreme Court today declined to review a lower court's ruling that barred theater owners from agreeing not to compete for particular films.

title: EX-PRIEST LED RIGHTS FIGHT
description: James E. Groppi, the former Roman Catholic priest who led more than 200 marches for open housing in the city in the tumultuous 1960's, died today. Mr. Groppi, who had been ill since he underwent surgery for a brain tumor a year ago, was 54 years old.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 5, 1985
description: Companies

title: UNIVERSITY GENETICS reports earnings for Year to July 31
description: b-Net income.

title: WOODWINDS: NOTES FROM UNDERGROUND
description: Take the A Train MUSIC UNDER NEW YORK, by the Ambrosian Wind Duo; Frances Cabrejos, flute; Joel Willett, bassoon; with about 140 other classical, jazz, rock and folk musicians sponsored by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority. AT: Times Square, Grand Central, Columbus Circle and other subterranean hot spots. Times vary.

title: Stake in Unocal
description: The Mesa Asset Company, a subsidiary of Mesa Petroleum Inc., said that it had decreased its stake in the Unocal Corporation about one percentage point, to 12.7 percent of the company's shares outstanding. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Mesa said that between July 11 and Sept. 30, it sold about 1 million Unocal common shares for prices ranging from $27.09, to $30.59 a share. Mesa, which is headed by T. Boone Pickens Jr., and Unocal were locked in a bitter takeover battle earlier this year.

title: EXCERPTS FROM THE DEFECTOR'S NEWS CONFERENCE AT EMBASSY
description: Following are excerpts from a news conference by Vitaly Yurchenko yesterday at the Soviet Embassy in Washington, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Election Choices
description: It's Election Day. Today's vote will determine, among other offices, the next Mayor of New York City and Governor of New Jersey. Voting in New York State will take place from 6 A.M. to 9 P.M. and in New Jersey from 7 A.M. to 8 P.M.

title: OFFSHORE OIL RIGS PROVE FERTILE FARM FOR MUSSELS ON THE COAST
description: To many residents along the scenic coast here, the 20 or so oil rigs that rise out of the sea a few miles off shore are ugly reminders of a disaster - an oil spill that in 1969 blackened miles of ocean and beaches.

title: RECITAL: CORBATO PIANIST
description: IT took Emily Corbato only a few movements of Schumann's ''Davidsbundlertanze'' to confirm the necessarily vaguer impression she had already made in less familiar music at Carnegie Recital Hall Sunday afternoon. Miss Corbato is a Boston-based pianist whose musical interests center on lesser-known American works and whose technical capacities include a fine delicacy in the spinning out of lyrical movements and an admirable ability to keep competing lines and sonorities out of one another's way.

title: METALBANC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
U.S. AGENCY THREATENS TO DELAY RULES PROTECTING TEXTILE WORKERS
description: The Office of Management and Budget has threatened to delay new regulations protecting textile workers against byssinosis, or brown lung disease, unless the Labor Department revises them to make compliance less costly to the textile industry, according to Labor Department officials.

title: Featherbed Under Glass
description: If a few New York union locals are allowed to turn the new Jacob K. Javits Convention Center into a huge featherbed of redundant jobs, construction work might as well stop right now. Prospective tenants won't be able to afford doing business there. Mayor Koch rightly calls attention to this danger, already well known to wise labor leaders and the managers of the public corporation completing the huge glass building.

title: Senator From Nebraska Is Ill
description: Senator Edward Zorinsky, Democrat of Nebraska, was listed in ''serious but stable'' condition at a hospital here where he was taken by ambulance from the Capitol this morning after complaining of chest pains. A spokesman for George Washington University Hospital said Mr. Zorinsky, who is 56 years old, was undergoing tests to determine whether he had suffered a heart attack.

title: HEALTHCARE INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
DATA-DESIGN LABORATORIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BRIDGE: WINNING AMERICAN PLAYERS PREPARE FOR CANADIAN MEET
description: The six American experts who won the world team championship here last week will have plenty of time to review a triumphant five days of play.

title: Strong Is Sentenced
description: Curtis Strong, the former caterer of the Philadelphia Phillies, was sentenced to 12 years in prison yesterday in Pittsburgh for selling cocaine to major league players by a Federal judge who warned baseball executives they ''must clean up their house.'' The 39-year-old Strong also was sentenced to 12 years of special parole following his prison term for his Sept. 20 conviction on 11 of 14 cocaine distribution charges.

title: Quotron Ends Merger Talks
description: Quotron Systems Inc., which provides electronic stock quotations to financial institutions, said today that its discussions about merging with a major company had ended.

title: Joseph C. Wells, Labor Lawyer And Taft-Hartley Act Adviser
description: Joseph C. Wells, a labor lawyer who helped formulate the Taft-Hartley Act of 1947, died Friday at Hartford Hospital. He was 71 years old.

title: REV. E. HOYT PALMER
description: The Rev. E. Hoyt Palmer, executive director of the St. John's Guild Floating Hospital in New York from 1948 to 1971, died at Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center last Thursday. He was 88 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: UP-RIGHT INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including extraordinary credits of $190,000 for the quarter and $300,000 for the nine months. c-Including an extraordinary credit of $443,000 for the quarter and the nine months.

title: MCA INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
DAY SCHOOL URGED FOR REFORM JEWS
description: The Reform Jewish movement, long a steadfast supporter of public school education, gave its endorsement yesterday for the first time to the establishment of Jewish day schools.

title: Three Die and Two Are Hurt In Head-On Car Crash on L.I.
description: A head-on car crash on a twisting, rural road here killed three men and injured two teen-age girls, the Suffolk County police said today.

title: Talks Resume in Strike At General Dynamics
description: As negotiations resumed today, the United Automobile Workers said it was seeking amnesty for more than 100 pickets fired or disciplined in the strike against the General Dynamics Corporation.

title: Housing in New York Needs a Fund Such as Highways Have
description: To the Editor:

title: CONFERTECH INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
PEOPLE EXPRESS AIRLINES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Shares outstanding reflect the impact of a 10 percent stock dividend paid as Class B common stock on Sept. 16, 1985.

title: CAGLE'S INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 28
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $1,000 for the quarter, a loss from discontinued operations of $22,000 for the 6 months and tax credits of $101,000 for the quarter and $177,000 for the 6 months. c-Net loss. d-Including income from discontinued operations of $61,000 for the quarter and $157,000 for the 6 months, an extraordinary charge of $32,000 for the quarter and a tax credit of $115,000 for the 6 months. Year-ago results have been restated to reflect discontinued operations.

title: AIC PHOTO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-After an extraordinary loss of $27,000 from the reversal of a tax credit. c-Including an accrued pretax legal expense of $250,000 incurred in connection with bankruptcy administration.

title: NEED FOR SEX EDUCATION CITED IN POLL
description: A major new study of American attitudes on sex discloses that an overwhelming majority regard teen-age pregnancy as a serious national problem requiring controversial new education efforts by schools and the media, especially television, as well as by parents.

title: BALDWIN & LYONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results for the latest periods include capital gains equal to 22 cents a share for the quarter and 6 cents a share for the 9 months. Year-ago results include capital gains equal to 60 cents a share for the quarter and $1.23 a share for the 9 months.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Atlanta Gas Light Co., Atlanta, has elected Joe T. Laboon chairman, succeeding W. L. Lee.

title: 13 BACKS GAIN 100 IN UNUSUAL RECORD
description: An unusual record was set in the 13 National Football League games Sunday, most running backs gaining 100 yards or more in one day: 13. The previous record was 10.

title: REDLAKE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss.

title: BRADLEY REAL ESTATE TRUST reports earnings for Year to Aug 31
description: b-Including a net capital gain of $395,045.

title: UNRAVELING THE PUZZLE OF SPACE MOTION SICKNESS
description: One day early in the current flight of the space shuttle Challenger, Dr. Ernst Messerschmid awoke with a strange feeling of inner conflict. His sensory organs could not tell up from down. His brain, programmed by long experience in response to the familiar tug of earth gravity, could not sort out the conflicting signals coming from the eyes and inner ear. For half an hour the West German scientist suffered from dizzying disorientation.

title: Lebanon Guerrilla Group Reports Car Bombing
description: A Lebanese guerrilla group asserted today that it had killed or wounded 15 Israeli or Israeli-allied troops in a car bomb explosion in southern Lebanon, but other reports cast doubt on the number of casualties.

title: REAGAN DROPS 11 IN FOREIGN POLICY ADVISORY GROUP
description: President Reagan has dismissed 11 of the 21 members of a committee of outside advisers who help him develop his foreign intelligence policies, the White House said today.

title: Speaking Out for the Disabled
description: Itzhak Perlman is spending a lot of time in Washington these days, playing his violin and, as well, calling attention to his campaign to help the disabled.

title: Judge in Boston Orders End to Railroad Strike
description: Boston & Maine Railroad workers walked off the job this morning, stranding 38,000 Boston commuters, but agreed tonight to return to work when a Federal judge granted a temporary restraining order against the strike. Train service was scheduled to resume Tuesday.

title: CIRCUIT RESEARCH LABORATOIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Numbers Game
description: Some random early-season notes from the desk of Harvey Pollack, director of public relations for the Philadelphia 76ers and unchallenged champion collector of oddball roundball numbers:

title: Tate & Lyle Official Appointed Chairman
description: Neil Shaw has been appointed chairman and chief executive of Tate & Lyle P.L.C., the British sugar company. He succeeds Sir Robert Haslam, who became deputy chairman of the National Coal Board Nov. 1 and is scheduled to become chairman next March.

title: French Identity Problems
description: The most interesting, and disturbing, French political phenomenon as this country moves toward crucial parliamentary elections next year is a chubby, pink-faced, platinum blond named Jean-Marie Le Pen.

title: SOVIET SCHOOLS BEGIN A COMPUTER CURRICULUM
description: SOVIET educators have begun a nationwide computer science program for the 9th and 10th grades that has everything except computers.

title: LURIA, L & SON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Advertising;   People
description: * Lynn Giordano has been named executive vice president and Elizabeth Fitterman senior vice president at SSC&B: Lintas USA. Donald V. Gill has joined as a senior vice president.

title: Alabama Sale Put At $180.5 Million
description: The Alabama Public School and College Authority is tentatively offering $180.5 million of refunding bonds through underwriters led by Merrill Lynch Capital Markets. The yields on interest-bearing bonds range from 6 1/4 perent for bonds due in 1988 to 7.70 percent in 1994.

title: DOW MOVES 0.57 LOWER, TO 1,389.68
description: Wall Street stock prices closed slightly lower yesterday, but a rally in the last 30 minutes reversed some of the profit taking that came earlier in the session.

title: PORTA SYSTEMS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a nonrecurring gain of $737,000 representing the cumulative effect on prior years of an accounting change.

title: President of Lydall Moves to New Top Post
description: Lydall Inc., a maker of industrial equipment based in Manchester, Conn., yesterday named its president and chief executive officer, Millard H. Pryor Jr., to the new post of chairman, effective immediately.

title: ITT Has 33.4% Drop In Quarter
description: The ITT Corporation, continuing to feel the impact of a weak telecommunications industry, reported yesterday that its net income in the third quarter of 1985 fell 33.4 percent from the 1984 quarter.

title: DALTEX MEDICAL SCIENCES reports earnings for Year to July 31
description: Revenues are derived from interest income.

title: SOUTHLAND ROYALTY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an after-tax writedown of $7,560,000 for the quarter and the nine months on the value of undeveloped acreage that the company plans to abandon. c-Net income.

title: PERFECT DATA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income.

title: WIN-SOME-LOSE-SOME DAY AT THE RACES
description: In their relentless quest for higher profits, the people who decide what sporting events get televised are apt to take a chance now and then on a show that might or might not attract viewers and advertising dollars. NBC's telecast of the second Breeders' Cup horse races on Saturday provided a clear example of the gains and losses that can occur when a risky venture goes big-time.

title: CBS OFFERS 'DINOSAUR!,' AN HOULONG SPECIAL
description: WHY dinosaurs? Why not dinosaurs? They had their good points, and they remain with us today, gracing T-shirts, hamburger stands and classroom science projects. Paleontologists are wild about them. They are the subject of a one-hour CBS special at 8 o'clock tonight -''Dinosaur!''

title: AIDS REMARK IS AT ISSUE IN HOUSTON VOTE TODAY
description: Houstonians will choose Tuesday between their new Mayor, Kathy Whitmire, and their old Mayor, Louie Welch. The polls show Mrs. Whitmire well ahead and even some of Mr. Welch's own confidants say privately that she will win easily.

title: GENERAL HOMES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
People Express Profit Jumps
description: People Express Inc. said yesterday that its third-quarter earnings more than doubled, to $16.4 million, or 55 cents a share, from $6.8 million, or 20 cents a share, a year ago.

title: READING & BATES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a writeoff of $5.8 million for the quarter and the nine months resulting from the retirement of a drillship and recognition of an operating loss of $5.6 million for the quarter and the nine months incurred by a 50-percent-owned civil construction joint venture. c-Net income, including a gain of $4,508,000 for the settlement of claims pertaining to prior Iranian operations.

title: JEFFERSON-PILOT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including capital gains of $788,000 for the quarter and $13,152,000,000 for the nine months. c-Including income from discontinued operations of $3,611,000 for the quarter and $7,493,000 for the nine months, capital loss of $760,000 for the quarter and a capital gain of $10,537,000,000 for the nine months.

title: OFFICIAL TESTIFIES PATIENT IN COMA PREFERS DEATH
description: A state official said today that ''there was every indication'' that a comatose woman being kept alive by an artifical feeding tube did not want to live in a vegetative state and would reject, if she could, the measures being taken to prevent her death.

title: MATRIX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings and shares outstanding have been restated for a 5-for-4 stock split paid in September.

title: Sonics Sign Higgins
description: Rod Higgins, a three-year National Basketball Association veteran from Fresno State, has been signed by the SuperSonics.

title: ULTIMATE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Transactions
description: BASEBALL TEXAS (AL) - Acquired Pete Incaviglia, outfielder, from Montreal for Jim Anderson, infielder, and Bob Sebra, pitcher.

title: SCIENCE DYNAMICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
American Medical
description: An investment group led by members of the Bass family of Texas said that it had increased its stake in American Medical International Inc. to 10.2 percent, from 8.7 percent.

title: Market Place;   The Seagram, Du Pont Link
description: BETWEEN early May and late July, the Bessemer Trust Companies purchased about 750,000 shares of the Seagram Company for clients at an average cost of $38 or $39 a share.

title: SILVERADO BANKING reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
PUPILS BOYCOTTING SCHOOL IN QUEENS
description: Most of the 950 students at a Queens elementary school were kept out of classes yesterday as their parents continued to protest a new heating system that they said spewed noxious fumes.

title: TEXAS EASTERN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
U.S. URGING A 'CREDIBLE' PHILIPPINE VOTE
description: The Reagan Administration today called on President Ferdinand E. Marcos to conduct the proposed early presidential elections in the Philippines in a ''credible and fair'' fashion, with ''broadly based'' citizen participation.

title: PALM BEACH INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
SHAPIRO IS 'STILL HOPING' TO UPSET KEAN AS CAMPAIGN WINDS DOWN
description: Peter Shapiro began his last full day of gubernatorial campaigning early today, ignoring polls that showed him lagging and again refusing to indulge in pre-election ''post-mortems.''

title: I.B.M. Reshuffles High-Level Officers
description: The International Business Machines Corporation yesterday announced a number of job changes among high-level executives.

title: FASSBINDER PLAY GIVEN A PRIVATE SHOWING
description: Abandoning plans to hold the world premiere today of Rainer Werner Fassbinder's ''Garbage, the City and Death,'' the manager of the city's repertory theater instead gave a private showing for critics in an attempt to defuse accusations that the play is anti-Semitic.

title: Electricity Bonds In North Carolina
description: A $275 million issue of electric revenue bonds of the North Carolina Municipal Power Agency was tentatively offered yesterday with a maximum yield of 9 5/8 percent for bonds due in 2015 through underwriters led by Merrill Lynch Capital Markts.

title: KANSAS CITY LIFE INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Per share figures reflect a 3-for-1 stock split paid in June 1985.

title: FOUR DARK YEARS TO END AT LINCOLN CENTER STAGE
description: After an absence of four years, theater is scheduled to return to Lincoln Center on a regular basis beginning Dec. 20 with two one-act plays by David Mamet - ''The Shawl'' and ''Prairie du Chien'' - to be followed on Feb. 14 by a revival of John Guare's ''House of Blue Leaves.''

title: POE & ASSOCIATES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $267,000 for the quarter and $542,000 for the 9 months.

title: SHULTZ, IN SOVIET, STARTS TO DRAFT SUMMIT PACTS
description: Senior United States and Soviet officials conferred here today to see what agreements could be reached for the meeting between President Reagan and Mikhail S. Gorbachev in Geneva this month, American diplomats said.

title: A Zinger by Nader
description: When Ralph Nader wins one, he is not overcome by shyness, and his magnanimity may be tempered with revenge. Years ago Mr. Nader and Nat Hentoff, the journalist, differed publicly on the particulars of a libel case involving the press.

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: DRESSED to the teeth, clutching Filofaxes, wearing sunglasses indoors and traveling in packs between Seventh Avenue's showrooms and Central Park's hotels, fashion's lemmings have come to New York for the spring collections that began last week. By now, they've lost some of the spring in their step, but they press on, drunk on design, sniffling with colds, gray with jet lag, carrying giveaway promotional bags they have yet to unpack from the European shows, already a memory.

title: LANCER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Yale President Rejects Plea to Run for Senate
description: Despite pressure from the chairman of the state Republican Party, Yale University President A. Bartlett Giamatti said today that he had decided not to run for the United States Senate in 1986.

title: NANOMETRICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a tax credit of $181,000. c-Net income.

title: PLAYING AT COMBAT FOR FUN AND PROFIT
description: Legions of New Yorkers are donning combat fatigues, plastering their faces with eerie green camouflage paint and pouring through forests to shoot one another with tiny paint balls that go splat.

title: NOBEL INSURANCE LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
GENERAL REFRACTORIES CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary tax charge of $600,000 for the quarter and an extraordinary tax credit of $350,000 for the 9 months. c-Net income. d-Including extraordinary tax credits of $500,000 for the quarter and $900,000 for the 9 months.

title: LUCILLE BALL PLAYS A BAG LADY ON CBS
description: CBS has taken the troubling phenomenon of bag ladies and turned it into a movie vehicle for Lucille Ball. Don't misunderstand. The marvelous Miss Ball deserves all the vehicles television can throw her way. But anyone in search of biting, or even illuminating, social insights in ''Stone Pillow'' - at 9 o'clock this evening -can look elsewhere, perhaps only as far as the streets outside the window.

title: OPERA: 'CAVALLERIA' AND 'PAGLIACCI' AT MET
description: AN opera company that cannot adequately cast ''Cavalleria Rusticana'' and ''Pagliacci'' needs to reassess its recruiting methods. The season's first performance of the Mascagni-Leoncavallo double bill at the Metropolitan Opera occasionally rose to the level of adequacy in the former work but lost all semblance of quality in the latter.

title: Massey-Ferguson To Close 2 Plants
description: Citing a severely constricted market for combine harvesters, Massey-Ferguson Industries Ltd. said that it would suspend combine production at its plants in Toronto and Brantford, Ontario, effective Nov. 15. The closings will idle 1,325 employees.

title: SCHOLARS HONOR SECRET OF A JAPANESE TREASURE
description: In Japan, an order obviously is to be obeyed even when the person who issued it has been dead for three centuries.

title: T. Oliver Morgan, 83, Is Dead; An Ex-McGraw-Hill Executive
description: T. Oliver Morgan, a retired McGraw-Hill executive and former executive vice president of the F. W. Dodge Corporation, died Oct. 25 of emphysema at Lawrence Hospital in Bronxville, N.Y. He was 83 years old. A former resident of Bronxville, he lived after his retirement on Key Largo, Fla.

title: BAKER, MICHAEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
Intel Shutdowns
description: The Intel Corporation, citing the depressed sales of semiconductors, said that it planned to close one of its two Oregon plants and lay off about 450 employees.

title: OPENING STATEMENTS MADE IN RACKETEERING TRIAL OF 11
description: The jury in the racketeering trial of the reputed leadership of the Colombo crime organization was told by a prosecutor yesterday that the ''family'' existed only to ''make money the easy way, the illegal way, any illegal way.''

title: Smid Eliminated
description: Peter Lundgren of Sweden, who practiced with the former world champion, Bjorn Borg, last year to improve his game, today upset the world's 15th-ranked player, Tomas Smid of Czechoslovakia, 4-6, 6-4, 6-2, on the opening day of the $75,000 Stockholm Open Grand Prix tennis tournament.

title: BIG GAINS IN A LAPTOP, FOR A PRICE
description: THE Tandy Corporation has introduced a new portable computer, the Model 600.

title: Advertising;   Advertising Career Directory Published
description: Covering the advertising business, one learns rather quickly what a tremendous lure it is for both the young and not so young, who are attracted by the books, movies and television shows that portray the excitement of the life, and the true and untrue tales of fabulous fortunes to be earned at the craft.

title: NO MINNEAPOLIS CONTEST BUT A FEW URBAN WOES
description: The Republicans did not field a candidate in Tuesday's election against Mayor Donald M. Fraser, who is expected to win his bid for a third term handily. But that does not mean that all is quiet in this city.

title: BATTERED EWING FEELS THE BURDEN
description: Patrick Ewing woke up this morning with a hangover.

title: MUSIC: VIENNA SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA
description: IMAGINE, if you will, a hypothetical French restaurant -long established, serving excellent food, with a creative chef at the helm - that just happens to share the same block with Lutece.

title: Nashville Water Bonds Given Yields Up to 9 3/8%
description: A $257 million issue of water and sewer revenue bonds of the Metropolitan Government of Nashville and Davidson County was tentatively offered yesterday with a maximum yield of 9 3/8 percent for bonds due in 2015 through underwriters led by Bear, Stearns & Company.

title: SIFCO INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including tax credits of $335,000 for the quarter and $1,048,000 for the 9 months. c-Net income. d-Including tax credits of $29,000 for the quarter and $229,000 for the 9 months.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Academy Insurance Group Inc., Valley Forge, Pa., said negotiations continue with Aachener und Muenchener Beteiligungs A.G. and certain other unknown investors for a proposed stock sale and the issuance of senior secured debt totaling $39 million.

title: WINDY SYMPHONY
description: In the huge, eccentric bowl that is Giants Stadium, the ribbons fluttering on the goal posts Sunday afternoon indicated that the wind was blowing in opposite directions.

title: Herzog Voted Best
description: Whitey Herzog, who managed St. Louis to the National League pennant in what was expected to be a rebuilding year for the Cardinals, was named National League manager of the year by the Baseball Writers Association of America yesterday, beating Pete Rose of Cincinnati by a point. Herzog received 11 first-place votes and 86 points in balloting by the panel composed of two writers from each of the 12 league cities.

title: PHONE-MATE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including extraordinary tax credits of $573,000 for the quarter and $708,000 for the 9 months. c-Net losses.

title: INTELLIGENT SYSTEMS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income. The company said the results for the latest second quarter and six months reflect decreased margins for personal computer enhancement board products and terminal business.

title: BINDLEY WESTERN INDUSTRY reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago results have been restated for a 2-for-1 stock split effective April 15, 1985.

title:
SNARES AWAITING REAGAN AT GENEVA;

ILLUSIONS ABOUT GORBACHEV
description: Mikhail S. Gorbachev has one major asset as he prepared for Geneva:

title: Mina Curtiss, Author And Editor, Dies at 89
description: Mina Curtiss, an author, editor, translator and teacher, died of a heart ailment Friday at Bridgeport (Conn.) Hospital. She was 89 years old and lived in Weston, Conn.

title: NATO Chief Visiting Turkey
description: Lord Carrington of Britain, secretary general of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, arrived here today for talks. He conferred on arrival at the airport with Foreign Minister Vahit Halefoglu, who was leaving for West Germany, and was later to see Prime Minister Turgut Ozal.

title: BARBARA G. OBRE
description: Barbara Guggenheim Obre, a well-known figure in Maryland horse racing and a daughter of the founder of New York's Guggenheim Museum, Solomon R. Guggenheim, died Friday in Monkton, Md. She was 81 years old. Mrs. Obre owned Merrylind Farms, a commercial horse breeding farm and raced under both her maiden name and under the name of her third husband, Henry Obre, who died in 1970. Mrs. Obre is survived by a sister, two sons, four grandchildren and four great-grandchildren. A funeral was held yesterday at St. James Episcopal Church in Monkton, where she had lived since she suffered a stroke six years ago.

title:
SNARES AWAITING REAGAN AT GENEVA;

Beware 'Summit Syndrome'
description: A series of intensive briefings, called ''fine-tuning,'' are giving President Reagan a firm grasp of Administration positions for his meeting with Mikhail S. Gorbachev in Geneva on Nov. 19 and 20. What the briefings cannot do is immunize him against Summit Syndrome - a tendency toward impetuousness on the lonely peaks of statesmanship, marked by unpremediated remarks and sometimes producing unexpected outcomes.

title: PRUDENTIAL FINANCIAL SERVCES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $5,770,000 from a reserve for losses associated with the reverse repurchase agreements with Bevill, Bresler & Schulman.

title: COLLEGES TEST THEIR WORK
description: AT the University of Tennessee in Knoxville, students must take achievement tests when they are freshmen and then again when they are seniors. At DePaul University in Chicago, students may be asked to take such tests a number of times in their freshman year. At Kean College of New Jersey in Union, a task force is being created to devise tests to measure students' progress.

title: CITIZENS SAVINGS & LOAN reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
STOCK OFFER BY MURDOCH MAY BE USED IN TV BID
description: Rupert Murdoch told the Federal Communications Commission today that the company he has created to purchase a group of television stations from Metromedia Inc. may offer stock to the public to help raise funds to finance the $1.4 billion takeover.

title: APPLE WILL INTEGRATE PRODUCTS
description: Apple Computer Inc., saying that it had regained its footing after the most tumultuous year in its history, outlined a plan yesterday to integrate its products in an ''I.B.M.-defined world'' of computer systems.

title: BERRA WILL NOT RETURN
description: In the Yankees' version of musical chairs played with coaches, Yogi Berra has chosen to sit out this round, declining Lou Piniella's invitation to join his staff. However, Sammy Ellis tied a George Steinbrenner-era record yesterday by becoming the team's pitching coach for the third time.

title: Who Did What? Just Ask Boda
description: In a 42-26 Tulsa victory last Saturday, Gordon Brown rushed for 214 yards and Steve Gage for 206, punching hole after hole in the Wichita State defense as surely as they were posing an obvious question: whether two players on the same college team had ever each run for 200 yards before. As usual, Steve Boda was ahead of the game.

title: C.I.A. GRANT RAISES QUESTIONS ON RESEARCH RULES AT HARVARD
description: Several years ago, according to Nadav Safran, a professor of Middle Eastern studies at Harvard, a representative of the Central Intelligence Agency dropped by his office to ask what he was working on.

title: DYNAMICS CORP OF AMERICA reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a gain of $3,095,000 for the quarter and 9 months from the settlement of litigation, a charge of $666,000 for the quarter and 9 months from a factory consolidation and restructuring of the company's agricultural business and a reserve of $1,171,000 for the quarter and 9 months from losses on marketable securities.

title: M.A. GORDON, 65, LABOR LAWYER
description: Murray A. Gordon, a lawyer who specialized in labor cases involving public employees, died of cancer yesterday at Beth Israel Medical Center. He was 65 years old and had homes in the Bronx and Manhattan.

title: ALTERNACARE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including extraordinary tax credits of $77,000 for the quarter and $125,000 for the 9 months. c-Including extraordinary tax credits of $88,000 for the quarter and $160,000 for the 9 months.

title: TRANSWAY INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
EXCERPTS FROM 4 SOVIET REPORTERS' ARTICLE ABOUT INTERVIEW
description: Following are excerpts from an article in Izvestia yesterday, titled ''Apropos of Ronald Reagan's Interview,'' as translated and distributed by Tass, the Soviet press agency:

title: REAGAN'S REMARKS DELETED BY SOVIET
description: In a full page of type, Izvestia today published its version of an interview with President Reagan by Soviet journalists, but omitted several significant points.

title: CHEMICAL LEAMAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
description: b-Net loss.

title: Tin Creditors Present Plan
description: The 16 creditors of the International Tin Council put forward proposals today for resolving the financial crisis in the world's tin market.

title: ASTROCOM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including an extraordinary tax credit of $243,000.

title: Giants Share First As Cowboys Fall
description: Neil Lomax brought St. Louis to life with a 46-yard touchdown pass to Pat Tilley early in the second half and added a clinching toss to J. T. Smith with four minutes left as the Cardinals ended a four-game losing streak by beating the Dallas Cowboys, 21-10, tonight.

title: Promotion for Palmer?
description: The next United States Ambassador to Hungary is expected to be R. Mark Palmer, the Deputy Assistant Secretary of State who is with Secretary of State George P. Shultz on his current trip to Moscow.

title: Artist of '60 Minutes'
description: Fourteen paintings were sold in 60 minutes the other night at an exhibition of paintings and drawings by Morley Safer.

title: BELZBERGS ACQUIRE 5.7% STAKE IN BID FOR POTLATCH
description: The Belzberg family of Vancouver, British Columbia, said today that it had acquired stock and options totaling 5.7 percent of the outstanding shares of the Potlatch Corporation, a forest products company based in San Francisco.

title: The Boaters Are Back
description: While a daring theft has left fewer Impressionist works for the public to see in Paris these days, the Phillips Collection has regained its most popular impressionist painting, ''The Luncheon of the Boating Party.'' This Renoir masterpiece, which the museum bought in 1923 for $125,000, is now considered priceless but is insured for an undisclosed amount all the same.

title: A Less Known Source For 'Citizen Kane'
description: To the Editor:

title: MGM/UA ENTERTAINMENT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Net income. c-Including a tax credit of $1,374,000. d-Including a tax credit of $28,471,000.

title: CASTELLANO NAMED AT CAR-THEFT TRIAL
description: A confessed murderer and car thief told a Federal jury yesterday that on four occasions he was told that Paul Castellano, the reputed leader of the Gambino crime organization, was the head of the stolen-car ring that employed him.

title: MCA's Net Rises 90.7%
description: MCA Inc., citing strong results from its films, said yesterday that earnings in the third quarter of 1985 climbed 90.7 percent, to $67.5 million, or 91 cents a share, from $35.4 million, or 49 cents a share, a year earlier. Revenues jumped 51.9 percent, to $626.7 million, from $412.7 million.

title: MAFIA INFORMER FOCUSES ON 2 MAIN DEFENDANTS
description: Testimony by a Mafia informer, Tommaso Buscetta, focused yesterday on the two main defendants in the ''pizza connection'' trial in Federal District Court in Manhattan.

title: Youth in Rambo Garb Held in Arrow Assault
description: A teen-ager costumed as the movie character Rambo fired a hunting arrow at a policeman before being smoked out of a culvert with tear gas, officials said today.

title: ON THE CHILL BALTIC, A CITY-STATE DROOPS GRACEFULLY
description: When Lubeck people talk about the world outside their medieval red-brick city, they treat it all pretty much as foreign territory. They speak of what's happening ''in the Federal Republic'' or contemplate making a trip ''to West Germany'' or ''to the west.''

title: TV'S COVERAGE OF SOUTH AFRICA
description: Comes now the challenge: South Africa has restricted the filming of ''any public disturbance, disorder, riot, public violence, strike or boycott, or any damage to any property, or any assault on or killing of a person.'' Everyone loses in a situation like this, including, although Pretoria seems unaware of it, the Government applying the restrictions. Meanwhile, a question arises: How will television cover South Africa now?

title: HIGH PLAINS OIL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
MARCO'S RIVALS TO PICK A CANDIDATE
description: The fragmented Philippine opposition parties began urgent meetings today to settle on a single candidate to oppose President Ferdinand E. Marcos in elections he said he would call.

title: TOTAL ASSETS PROTECTION INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a tax credit of $1,806. c-Net loss. d-Net income, including a tax credit of $161,800.

title: PHOENIX MEDICAL TECHOLOGY reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a tax credit of $106,000.

title: SIS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
SENIOR K.G.B. MAN DEFECTING AGAIN, BACK TO MOSCOW
description: Vitaly Yurchenko, a K.G.B. officer described as one of the most senior Russian officials ever to defect to the West, announced today that he was returning to the Soviet Union.

title: NEW ZEALAND DENIES PARIS DEAL
description: Prime Minister David Lange denied today that New Zealand had made a political deal with France in return for dropping murder charges against two French agents accused of sinking the Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior.

title: Pohl Rules Out Interest Policy
description: The Group of Five, composed of major industrial nations, has not adopted a joint policy of raising interest rates to depress the dollar, according to Karl Otto Pohl, president of West Germany's central bank.

title: MICRO-CAD PAINTING OUTDOES CONNECTING THE DOTS
description: COMPUTER doodling programs are proliferating. In most cases the result is no more than electronic cookie cutting in the paint-by-number tradition. But there is one place where drawing with electronic tools instead of the traditional pen and ink really shines: computer-aided design.

title: Craxi Criticizes U.S. On Use of Base in Crisis
description: Prime Minister Bettino Craxi today criticized the United States' use of a military base in Sicily in the Achille Lauro hijacking crisis, but he strongly reaffirmed Italy's friendship with America.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Nov. 5, 1985 GENERAL ASSEMBLY Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Jordan Out 6 Weeks
description: Michael Jordan, the Chicago Bulls' scoring sensation, has a broken bone in his left foot and will be out of action for at least six weeks, the club said yesterday. Jordan, last season's N.B.A. rookie of the year, injured his foot against the Golden State Warriers last Tuesday and played less than half the game, scoring 12 points.

title: NASH FINCH CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
CORRECTION
description: An art review in Weekend on Oct. 18, discussing ''Wit in Sculpture'' at the Ingber Gallery, 415 West Broadway, misidentified a sculptor. She is Rosemary Cove.

title: Forsch Makes Bid For Chromalloy
description: The Chromalloy American Corporation has received an unsolicited tender offer from the Forsch Corporation to acquire all of its stock for $17.50 a share, or a total of about $267 million.

title: CHRISTIANA COMPANIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a tax credit of $523,000. c-Including a tax credit of $128,000.

title: I.B.M. EXHIBITS SPACE PHOTOGRAPHS
description: FROM now until Jan. 4, visitors to the I.B.M. Gallery of Art and Science at Madison Avenue and 56th Street will be able, indirectly but vividly, to experience a succession of space voyages to the Moon, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn and the moons orbiting those planets. They will also be able to look down on the Earth with radar ''eyes'' that penetrate dense vegetation and desert sands, showing landscapes otherwise hidden to view.

title: DEWHURST GETS O'NEILL MEDAL
description: The Eugene O'Neill Birthday Medal was awarded last night to Colleen Dewhurst ''for enriching the universal understanding'' of the United States' only Nobel Prize-winning playwright.

title: RANGERS REVIVED BY VICTORY
description: John Vanbiesbrouck sat in a corner of the clubhouse and said that he was relieved to ''get Saturday night out of his mind.'' Mike Allison was overjoyed ''just to contribute on an important night.'' And Coach Ted Sator talked about ''not letting a demise like that happen again.''

title: ALFONSIN PARTY WINS IN ARGENTINA BUT THE EXPECTED SWEEP ELUDES IT
description: Nearly complete returns from midterm congressional elections Sunday showed that the Radical Party of President Raul Alfonsin had won 43 percent of the national vote, giving the civilian leader a solid victory but falling far short of the hoped-for sweep.

title: Player Suspended
description: Long Island University's undefeated soccer team will be without Maicol Antello of Bolivia, the talented freshman right wing, for today's clash with rival Columbia because of a one-game suspension for his ejection in last Saturday's triumph against Hartwick.

title: TRIO-TECH INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
description: b-Including an extraordinary tax credit of $80,000.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: POLITICAL MURDER. From Tyrannicide to Terrorism. By Franklin L. Ford. 440 pages. Illustrated. Harvard. $29.50.

title: AMERICAN INTEGRITY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
SYLVAN LEARNING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a tax credit of $1,716 for the quarter and the six months. Year-ago share earnings are not available because the comapny went public in July 1985.

title: Elections and Expense
description: The New York City elections today will cost $2.5 million - roughly $2 a voter.

title: CASE ON RIGHT OF EX-MENTAL PATIENT
description: The Supreme Court agreed today to rule on the constitutionality of a Federal law that prohibits anyone ever committed to a mental institution from buying a gun for the rest of his life.

title: U.S. Capital Seeks Jersey Casino-Hotel
description: A South Carolina real estate development company said yesterday that it was negotiating to acquire a casino-hotel in Atlantic City, and the gambling community believes that the talks are with Resorts International.

title: UNC Resources
description: UNC Resources Inc. said it had agreed to acquire the Airwork Corporation and the Pacific Airmotive Corporation from Purex Industries for $108 million. Airwork and Pacific provide service to business, military and commuter-regional airlines and helicopters. They also provide maintenance and repair for auxiliary power units as well as accessory systems for aircraft and turbine engines used by the electric utility, gas and oil and marine industries.

title: No Substitute(s) for Jet Victory
description: Why would a coach, enjoying a lead that reached 32 points and with the Miami Dolphins coming up next, keep his key offensive players - both of them bruised - in the game until the end?

title: EXAR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are for the second quarter ended Sept. 30, 1985. The company made its initial public offering in August so no current 6 months results or year-ago results were reported.

title: RESDEL INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a tax credit of $180,000. c-Net loss.

title: The Star Wars War
description: There is no sure shield against the fallout from the war between groups battling over whether the United States should have the Strategic Defense Initiative system proposed by President Reagan. As Mr. Reagan's summit with Mikhail S. Gorbachev approaches, the battle is apparently heightening.

title: NAPCO SECURITY SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings have been adjusted to reflect the stock split paid in the form of a dividend in August 1985.

title: Advertising;   Ally & Gargano Resigns From Polaroid Account
description: Ally & Gargano, for 15 months the Polaroid Corporation's domestic film and camera agency, has resigned effective Feb. 28 from the $30 million account rather than engage in a competition for a new product assignment to which all of the business is being tied.

title: Advertising;   A.N.A., At 75, Still Changing
description: THE Association of National Advertising is preparing to celebrate its 75th anniversary at its annual three-day meeting at the Boca Raton Hotel in Florida beginning next Monday.

title: SOVIET SOLDIER LEAVES U.S. EMBASSY IN AFGHANISTAN
description: A 19-year-old Soviet soldier left the American Embassy in Afghanistan with the Soviet Ambassador today after being promised that he would not be prosecuted for seeking refuge in the embassy, the State Department said.

title: U.S. TO CHECK TREATMENT OF CITY'S HISPANIC VOTERS
description: The Justice Department said yesterday that it would send 107 observers to New York City to monitor the treatment of Spanish-speaking voters in today's election.

title: THE NATIONAL GUARDIAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including tax credits of $141,000 for the quarter and $485,000 for the nine months.

title: Arafat Arrives in Cairo To Meet With Mubarak
description: The Palestine Liberation Organization leader, Yasir Arafat, arrived here this evening for talks with Egyptian officials aimed at shoring up the faltering Jordanian-Egyptian Middle East peace initiative.

title: IN VIRGINIA, A REPUBLICAN SEES SIGNS OF HOPE, BUT POLLS DO NOT
description: All weekend, Wyatt B. Durrette, the Republican candidate for Governor, talked of a swell of support as Virginia moved toward Election Day. ''The movement in our direction is dramatic,'' he declared at a luncheon here Friday, with Secretary of Education William J. Bennett at his side to signal the Reagan Administration's support.

title: NEWS SUMMARY: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 5, 1985
description: International

title: PANTRY PRIDE CONTROL OF REVLON BOARD SEEN NEAR
description: Pantry Pride Inc. could reach agreement to take control of the Revlon Inc. board of directors as soon as today, and meanwhile it is holding discussions with potential purchasers of some Revlon operations, sources close to Pantry Pride said yesterday.

title: GURU RETURNING TO FACE CHARGES
description: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh, spiritual leader of a sect claiming to have 500,000 members around the world, left for Oregon today to face charges that he violated immigration laws.

title: Treasury Rates Are Mixed
description: Interest rates in the Treasury market were mixed yesterday with rates unchanged to slightly higher on issues due in less than three years, but slightly lower for longer-term issues.

title: SENATE WANTS BILL ON CORPORATE TAX
description: The Senate voted overwhelmingly today to require Congressional committees to send legislation to the floor by April 15 that would establish a minimum tax on corporations.

title: UNITIL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
E.S.M.'S REGULATORS ASSAILED
description: The Federal Home Loan Bank Board came under sharp criticism from members of a Congressional panel today. They assailed it for not taking action soon enough to keep the failure of E.S.M. Government Securities Inc. of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., from afflicting large savings and loan associations in Florida and Ohio.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: HEAVEN AND EARTH The large, luxurious I.B.M. Gallery of Science and Art (590 Madison Avenue, at 57th Street), is below ground, but the two exhibitions opening there today will elevate the spirit sky-high.

title: CALL TO SAKHAROVS BREAKS THROUGH A LONG SILENCE
description: Andrei D. Sakharov, the Soviet physicist and rights activist, today broke the silence imposed on him for nearly six years of internal exile by sharing in a telephone call from his anxious family in the United States.

title: PERINI INVESTMENT PROPERIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Tampering Charge Is Made by L.S.U.
description: Alfredo (Tito) Horford, a 7-foot freshman from the Dominican Republic, was put off the Louisiana State University basketball team by Coach Dale Brown on Saturday because he missed a practice last Friday and then refused to attend an intrasquad scrimmage Saturday. He will not be permitted to return.

title: WRIGHT, WILLIAM E CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After $460,000 in charges related to tender offer defense. c-Net income.

title: U.S. LEGISLATORS APPEAR STUNNED
description: A Soviet defector's announcement today that he would return home stunned leading members of Congress. But most defended the conduct of American intelligence in the case and dismissed the defector's assertion that he had been kidnapped by the United States.

title: CORRECTION
description: A listing of candidates in Metropolitan Report yesterday misstated the party designation of Theresa A. Altilio, a candidate for the Westchester County Legislature in the Second District. She is a Democrat.

title: UNITED OKLAHOMA BANKSHARES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income.

title: Jury Clears Teen-Ager In Classmate's Slaying
description: A teen-ager who said she feared for her life when she stabbed a classmate to death in a high school hallway was acquitted today of murder and manslaughter.

title: EXCERPTS FROM REAGAN'S INTERVIEW WITH 4 SOVIET JOURNALISTS
description: Following are excerpts from President Reagan's interview last Thursday with four Soviet journalists, as recorded and transcribed by the White House Press Office and made public today. The material in italics, between brackets, was omitted from Russian and English versions of the interview distributed by the Soviet Union.

title: Mary Gordon to Read
description: A free reading will be given by the author Mary Gordon on Nov. 14 at 12:15 P.M. in the auditorium at Chase Manhattan Plaza, Nassau and Liberty Streets. Miss Gordon will read from her most recent book, ''Men and Angels,'' as well as from her other works, ''Final Payments'' and ''The Company of Women.'' The reading is the fourth in a series sponsored by the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council.

title: DANCE: EL MORAO, A FLAMENCO TROUPE
description: BECAUSE Whitman Hall at Brooklyn College is a large theater and El Morao, the Flamenco troupe that performed there Sunday night, is a little company, one feared that the hall might dwarf this group of two guitarists, three singers and two dancers. But passion triumphed over physical dimensions and El Morao soon made Whitman Hall seem as intimate as any gypsy nightspot in Andalusia.

title: CHRISTIAN DEMOCRAT TAKES BIG LEAD IN GUATEMALA
description: The Christian Democratic candidate for President finished a strong first in elections Sunday to return Guatemala to civilian government, but fell short of winning a clear majority, according to incomplete results made public today, The Christian Democrat, Marco Vinicio Cerezo Arevalo, called on the second-place finisher, Jorge Carpio Nicolle, to withdraw from the race so that a runoff election could be avoided. But Mr. Carpio said he was not prepared to do so.

title: DAZZLING DAYS FOR SABERHAGEN
description: Everything has been happening so quickly. First Janeane Saberhagen delivered, and then her husband did. Then Bret Saberhagen was expertly shooting champagne out of a bottle - again - and accepting an award as the most valuable player in the World Series, and talking to President Reagan on the telephone, and picking shreds of paper off his shoulders during a parade, and heading to Washington and talking to the President - again - and going to New York for an award as the most valuable player in the World Series. Again. Saberhagen had never before tasted champagne that had aged during the playoffs or World Series. He had never won a postseason game. He had never been voted the most valuable player of a Series and he had never talked to a President. Suddenly, at the age of 21, after his second season with the Kansas City Royals, he could experience a sense of deja vu. He had never handed out cigars, either. His wife is probably relieved that she gave birth to just one son.

title: WHALE CROSSES GOLDEN GATE AFTER 3 1/2-WEEK RIVER TOUR
description: Humphrey the wayward whale, lured by the flutelike recorded sounds of fellow humpbacks feeding, splashed through the Golden Gate into the Pacific Ocean today after a three-and-a-half-week freshwater cruise that made him a national celebrity.

title: Thomson CSF
description: Thomson CSF is in advanced talks with Allied-Signal Inc.'s subsidiary the Bendix Corporation to acquire its avionics unit, Air Equipement, Thomson sources said.

title: SCIENTIFIC COMPUTERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Blank Screen in South Africa
description: The new curbs South Africa has just imposed on reporting of the country's sorrows and disorders will hinder the world's understanding. Worse, they may prolong them. The huge, rebellious black majority lacks for any real communication in that deeply divided society. Independent press accounts have offered about the only public outlet for their grievances; to curtail is to inflame.

title: City Opens a Shelter For 100 in Brooklyn
description: The city has opened a new shelter for the homeless, its 19th, on the grounds of the former Greenpoint Hospital in Brooklyn.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I know your side. It's better than reading a thousand books.''

title: Q&A
description: Q.

title: RECITAL: STEPHEN HOUGH, PIANIST
description: READING the list of Walter W. Naumburg Foundation winners since 1925 can soothe the competition process's sourest of enemies, at least for a minute or two. Large numbers of Naumburg successes really seem to have added to the substance of professional musical life - Adele Marcus (1928), Jorge Bolet (1937), William Kapell and Robert Mann (both 1941), Joseph Silverstein (1960) and Lucy Shelton (1980).

title: Takoma Park and Democracy
description: Sam Abbott plants his feet behind a makeshift podium in the Takoma Park Municipal Building, thrusts his hands in his pockets and begins an oral assault on American immigration policy. He is 77 years old and almost frail of stature, but the voice of the old union organizer, tough and combative, has not deserted him.

title: OPERA: 'DON GIOVANNI,' IN BROOKLYN
description: TO bring a troupe of young American singers from the West Coast to put on a standard opera like ''Don Giovanni'' in New York City might seem a bit odd, like a Broadway deli deciding to import bagels from Philadelphia every morning. But the Western Opera Theater offered a solid performance at Brooklyn College Saturday night - and at the same time prompted questions about the state of small-scale opera here and on the road.

title: OPEC Output Rise Reported
description: Crude oil production by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries rose to 17.3 million barrels a day in October, the Middle East Economic Survey said today.

title: What Reagan Means by Judicial Responsibility
description: To the Editor:

title: A TRUCK PULL GATHERS SPECTATORS AND SPONSORS
description: As 35,000 people in the Silverdome stadium here watch and cheer, a heavily modified pickup truck with a supercharged engine and fat, ribbed tires churns its way across the tightly packed dirt, dragging a huge sled carrying a 40,000-pound weight.

title: PRESIDENTIAL LIFE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including realized investment gains of $621,000 for the quarter and $2,406,000 for the nine months. c-Including realized investment gains of $112,000 for the quarter and $1,135,000 for the nine months.

title: FLOW GENERAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BRAVURA FASHION FROM ITALY
description: An exhibition that celebrates the creative sweep of Italian fashion opens today at the Fashion Institute of Technology.

title: China Curbs Car Imports
description: China said today that it would ban most vehicle imports for two years to stem a flood of Japanese cars, preserving its dwindling foreign-exchange reserves and encouraging ''domestic technological progress.''

title: CASE ON RIGHTS FOR HOMOSEXUALS WILL BE HEARD BY SUPREME COURT
description: The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether the Constitution protects consenting adults from prosecution for private homosexual acts.

title: UNIFORCE TEMPORARY PERONNEL reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
A COMPUTER CHIP MAKER IN THE BLACK
description: At a time when most semiconductor companies are suffering from losses, layoffs and plant closings, the LSI Logic Corporation is breaking out the champagne. The company, only five years old, has passed $100 million in sales this year and remains one of the few profitable chip makers in Silicon Valley.

title: SYM-TEK SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Indian Tax Crackdown
description: A crackdown on India's tax-dodging black economy today caught one of the country's top textile millionaires. Kapal Mehra, a prominent figure in Indian business circles, was remanded in custody until Friday on charges of avoiding duty of $1.3 million on goods bought from C. Itoh & Company of Japan in 1982 and 1983.

title: THREE PAST PRESIDENTS MAY BRIEF REAGAN
description: President Reagan is trying to arrange meetings with former Presidents Jimmy Carter, Gerald R. Ford and Richard M. Nixon and with former national security advisers as preparations for the summit meeting with Mikhail S. Gorbachev go into high gear, according to officials.

title: SYMBION INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BRIEFS
description: Debt Issues

title: History Without a Journal
description: ''I'm happy to be here at the Brooklyn Historical Society,'' Brooklyn Borough President Howard Golden said at a recent reception at the society's headquarters.

title: High-Heeled Instruments of Torture
description: To the Editor:

title: WEINBERGER VOWS NO BARGAINING ON 'SOVIET WARS'
description: Secretary of Defense Caspar W. Weinberger said yesterday that it would be ''the height of irresponsibility'' to bargain away research on President Reagan's Strategic Defense Initiative on a high-technology defense against nuclear missiles.

title: CHARGES PLAGUE POLICE IN MIAMI AREA
description: The recent arrest of a number of police officers here has increased concern over the temptations of South Florida's multibillion-dollar drug traffic and brought the announcement of several investigations into allegations of police corruption.

title: U.S. SAYS MOSCOW SHIPS MORE ARMS TO NICARAGUANS
description: The Reagan Administration asserted today that there had been a ''serious increase'' in Soviet arms shipments to Nicaragua, with weaponry being moved through Cuba in recent weeks.

title: Key Rates
description: * Municipal Bond Index, The Bond Buyer Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: Decline in Diabetes Deaths
description: The mortality rate for diabetes, the seventh leading cause of death in the United States, has dropped nearly one-third in the last decade, according to statistics from the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company.

title: Chrysler Workers Strike Plant in Missouri
description: The Chrysler Corporation's No. 2 assembly plant here was shut down today for the second time in a month as 2,800 members of the United Automobile Workers walked off the job after talks broke down on a new local contract.

title: MCRAE INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 3
description: b-Net losses.

title: METROPOLITAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results for the latest quarter and year reflect the sale of Metropolitan's office building for $11.2 million and the sale of approximately $73 million of below-market fixed rate mortgage loans at a pretax loss of $8.3 million. Metropolitan Savings & Loan converted to a stock savings and loan association from a mutual savings and loan in July 1985.

title: FIRST CAROLINA INVESTORS reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Mexico Intensifies Its Search For Killers of 22 Policemen
description: More than 600 policemen, soldiers and farmers converged today on a remote marijuana-growing area of southern Mexico to search for drug traffickers that the authorities believe tortured and killed 22 officers.

title: SLOANE, W & J CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
description: b-After a loss of $5,584,169 due to the increased transitional expenses related to the company's expansion program and writedowns and adjustments totaling $6,570,019. c-Net income. The company and its subsidiaries filed voluntary petitions for reorganization under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code on September 9. The company has increased the number of its retail furniture outlets from 9 to 32.

title: CONSUMERS WATER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a nonrecurring gain of $1.9 million, or 78 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months from the sale of the Erie Suburban division of Pennsylvania Water Co., a subsidiairy.

title: Taiwan Currency Rules
description: Taiwan's central bank said today that it was relaxing its foreign-exchange controls by letting individuals participate in forward currency trades.

title: OPEC Head Sees No Shift
description: The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries has not changed its policy on oil prices, but new practices may be considered at future meetings, OPEC's president said.

title: People
description: Thomas J. Turner, president of SSC&B:Vos Direct, has been named to the additional post of chairman.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL HOUSTON (NL) - Named Hal Lanier manager.

title: HIGH COURT HEARS 2 ABORTION CASES
description: Two major abortion cases came before the Supreme Court today in oral arguments that were marked more by legal fine points than ideological or political fervor.

title: ON L.I., FIGHTS FOLLOW A FILM ON RAP MUSIC
description: The movie ''Krush Groove'' is a somewhat slapstick comedy filled with song and dance and containing little violence, yet on several occasions violent incidents have broken out following a showing.

title: K.G.B. CASE CALLED INTELLIGENCE REVERSAL FOR U.S.
description: To American intelligence officials, Vitaly Yurchenko's defection had seemed an extraordinary coup, a signal that the tide in the ideological war was turning in favor of the United States.

title: KARPOV A PAWN UP
description: The 22d game of the world championship chess match between Anatoly Karpov, the current title holder, and Gary Kasparov was adjourned today.

title: CONTINENTAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a capital loss of $6.7 million for the quarter, a capital gain of $50.1 million for the 9 months, income from discontinued operations of $600,000 for the 9 months and a gain of $1.3 million for the 9 months on the disposal of discontinued operations. c-Including capital gains of $40.7 million for the quarter and $290.9 million for the 9 months and income from discontinued operations of $800,000 for the quarter and $1.9 million for the 9 months.

title: Beatrice Sets Talks
description: The Beatrice Companies will meet with Kohlberg, Kravis, Roberts & Company of New York next Tuesday to discuss a possible management buyout, Wall Street sources said.

title: Nothing Excuses the Holland Hotel
description: There are plenty of excuses for the Holland Hotel, where New York City stows burned-out or evicted welfare families near Times Square. No excuses are good enough.

title: FIRST CONNECTICUT SMALL BUSINESS INVESTMENT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After net realized losses on investments of $44,635 for the quarter and $41,499 for the 6 months. c-After net realized losses on investments of $45,717 for the quarter and $47,126 for the 6 months. Total income figures represent total investment income. Net income figures represent net investment income.

title: GENCORP PLANS STOCK BUYBACK
description: Gencorp Inc., which was once known as the General Tire and Rubber Company, said yesterday that it would ask its board to authorize the buyback of ''a significant'' portion of its stock, using some $700 million in pretax proceeds, principally from the sale of two television stations.

title: WAS MORMON CHURCH LEADER
description: Spencer W. Kimball, the president and prophet of the Mormon church since 1973 and one of its most energetic leaders until age and infirmity curtailed his ministry, died late tonight. He was 90 years old.

title: PERRY ELLIS RETURNS TO SPORTSWEAR LOOK
description: AFTER a few seasons of trying to develop a new image, Perry Ellis is back to designing sportswear again. He's one of the best in this specialized all-American field and it's good to have him designing casual clothes with simplicity and flair.

title: BASIC AMERICAN MEDICAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income. Share earnings and shares outstanding give retroactive effect to a 10 percent stock dividend declared April 26, 1985.

title: Fixed Mortgage Rates Down Slightly in Month
description: Interest levels on fixed-rate home mortgages dropped slightly between early September and early October, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported yesterday. But economists said the changes were too small to be considered significant.

title: FLAMES TIE ISLANDERS
description: Time was when the Islanders not only expected to win on their home ice, their championship history practically demanded it. Tonight at Nassau Coliseum they were gratified to emerge with a 4-4 tie against the Calgary Flames.

title: U.S. OBSERVERS MONITOR VOTING AT POLLS IN CITY
description: Federal observers fanned out yesterday to polling places in three boroughs of New York City to check on the treatment of Spanish-speaking voters.

title: THE SCREEN: 'SUBWAY'
description: THE clever young French director Luc Besson made ''Le Dernier Combat'' as a black-and-white, virtually wordless science fiction opus. And he has approached ''Subway,'' which takes place almost entirely underground, in a similar spirit of gamesmanship. ''Subway,'' which opens today at Cinema 2, seems to have been conceived primarily as a logistical challenge for Mr. Besson, affording him the opportunity to turn the bowels of the Paris Metro into an eccentric-filled microcosm. What came second, after the sheer fun of staging domestic scenes, musical interludes and roller-skate chases in the underground, were the dramatic elements that might have made this more than just an interesting exercise.

title: INTERSTATE SECURITIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
PLANNING EARLY FOR THE 4TH OF JULY
description: Let others grouse about the onset of Christmas merchandising coming so early in the year. New Yorkers are frantically making plans for the Fourth of July.

title: 'School's the Move' Campaign Starts in City
description: Once Esther Ferguson became interested in the New York City Drop-Out Prevention Fund it wasn't long before Young & Rubicam became interested. Then the first thing you know Bill Cosby was interested.

title: Seductive Summitry
description: The Reagan-Gorbachev meeting approaches and summit seductions are upon us. The Russians let Andrei Sakharov telephone his family for the first time in six years and offer to let his wife travel to the West. And they have published an interview with an American President for the first time in 24 years. These manipulations obviously are meant to make the Soviet Union look less repressive and to make its policies look more reasonable.

title: A NEW BATTLE FOR THESE VETERANS
description: DURING their years in the service, some had not yet come to realize they were homosexuals. Others were aware of it but kept the matter to themselves or confided in the few others in the same situation. To acknowledge it, they knew, could abruptly end their military careers.

title: Forget Philippine Bases
description: Americans concerned about the Philippines may have been reassured by President Ferdinand E. Marcos's announcement this week that he intends to hold early Presidential elections at the beginning of the year. By itself, however, this guarantees nothing, and it does nothing to mitigate the foolishness of Washington's recent decision to increase investment in the American military bases at Clark Field and Subic Bay.

title: U.N. URGED TO PROMOTE WOMEN
description: Maureen Reagan today urged the United Nations to improve the status of women in its own organization as a way to advance the cause of women around the world.

title: Texas Housing Bonds Offered
description: A $154 million issue of single-family-housing revenue bonds of the Texas Housing Agency was tentatively offered yesterday through Merrill Lynch Capital markets with a maximum yield on interest-bearing bonds of 9.42 percent for bonds due in 2015.

title: Nets Add to String Of Home Victories
