description: His look was full of relief, as if he were pleased that the night had finally ended and his team had finally won. It almost seemed as if Dave Wohl realized the evening could have come to a disastrous conclusion.

title: EXCHANGE SEATS WON IN TOKYO
description: The Tokyo Stock Exchange today chose three American and three British securities firms as members, marking the first time foreign firms will be allowed to join the 107-year-old exchange.

title: STRENGTH IN NUMBERS
description: Frustrated by the waning civil-rights movement and virtually ignored by that of the feminists, 24 young black women banded together in 1970 to form the Coalition of 100 Black Women.

title: Training Aims at Wind Shifts
description: The Transportation Department has awarded a $1.8 million contract for a training program to help pilots detect and handle sudden wind shifts, the phenomenon blamed for several airliner crashes including one in Dallas in August that killed 137 people.

title: ON 'FIRST' DAY OF CHRISTMAS, NEW YORK GOES A-SHOPPING
description: As New Yorkers sought creative uses for leftover Thanksgiving turkey, the Christmas season arrived here yesterday - at least as far as the city's stores and shoppers were concerned.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
GUILTY PLEA IN $4 MILLION TAX EVASION
description: The art dealer Andrew Crispo pleaded guilty yesterday to charges that he had evaded nearly $4 million in Federal taxes by claiming he had bought art works that never existed.

title: U.S. IS REPORTED TO HAVE SENT AID FOR MALTA RESCUE
description: American antiterrorism experts were on their way here to help Egypt try to free the hostages aboard a hijacked Egyptian airliner last weekend but did not arrive before Egyptian commandos stormed the plane, Maltese and other sources close to the investigation of the episode said today.

title: Article 192899 -- No Title
description: Nelson Mandela, the jailed South African black leader, and his wife, Winnie, were named today as winners of the 1985 Third World Prize of $100,000. Its sponsors, the London-based Third World Foundation for Social and Economic Studies, said Mr. Mandela ''is honored for his message of freedom'' and described Mrs. Mandela as a ''symbol of the anti-apartheid campaign in South Africa.''

title: FRANCHISEIT CORP reports earnings for Year to Aug 31
description: b-Net income

title: MECHANICAL DEVICE HARVESTS CRAYFISH
description: A crayfish harvester, the first mechanical device for this purpose, is the subject of a patent awarded this week to Robert J. Edling and Karl L. Morgan of the agricultural engineering department at Louisiana State University in Baton Rouge.

title: A TRAVELING BAHAI DIPLOMAT
description: She seems old-fashioned on first appearance, an elderly blond woman sitting erect, speaking with measured sobriety about her purpose at the United Nations - more like a traditional New England dowager than the leader of a predominantly Eastern faith.

title: FLOOD CONTROL DIKE
description: John A. Paoluccio of Modesto, Calif., has devised a dike to be filled with water and sand and used for flood control. He believes it will replace the costly use of sandbags.

title: Hayes's Best Move
description: He had a spectacular 16-year career in the National Basketball Association, but when he retired from the Houston Rockets in 1984 as the league's No. 3 career scorer and rebounder, Elvin Hayes thought he had missed something in life. Next month he will get it - a college degree.

title: ANSWERS TO QUIZ
description: 1. A new torch was raised to the right hand of the Statue of Liberty, completing a major step in the renovation of the famed monument. 2.

title: MOSCOW SAYS U.S. SCORNS ARMS CONTROL
description: The Soviet press accused the United States today of violating the unratified strategic arms treaty and said officials in Washington were more concerned with lying about purported treaty breaches than curbing the arms race.

title: TELESPHERE INTL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-After a gain of $1,441,000 from the cumulative effect in prior years of an accounting change.

title: ISRAELI ANTITERROR AIDE REPORTEDLY HAD 2 JOBS
description: The senior Israeli counterterrorism official who purportedly ran an espionage operation in Washington was also a top official in an agency that collected scientific data, Israeli sources said today.

title: Best in the West
description: Penn State may be the unanimous ruler of the roost in big-time college football, at least until after the bowl games, but half a notch down, in Division I-AA, the best team is way out west. That's the judgment of The New York Times's computer, which, at the end of the regular season, was fed information on all I-AA squads and then spit out this top-20 list, complete with power ratings: 1.

title: Psychology and Technique Are a Professor's Strengths
description: Experts in psychology are sometimes weak in technique and vice versa. But one cannot level such an accusation at the reader who contributed the deal shown. He is Barry Schwartz, a professor of psychology at Swarthmore College, and he provided some high-level technical analysis.

title: THE NEW LAW: HOW IT WORKS
description: The effect of the new law is to raise the minimum legal drinking age from 19 to 21 in New York State.

title: Arizona Man Receives Heart-Lung Transplant
description: A man who waited a year for a donation of human lungs and a heart underwent transplant surgery today and was later reported to be recuperating in critical condition.

title: Boon for Latecomers
description: The National Gallery of Art is setting all kinds of attendance records with its current show on the treasures of British country houses, but so few people are aware of the extended evening hours that latecomers usually can get in without standing in line.

title: PERMITS ARE DROPPED FOR COMET-WATCHERS
description: Permits will no longer be necessary for those wishing to view Halley's comet from Jones Beach, State Park Department officials say.

title: MILITARY CONTRACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (Reuters) -

title: Doubts Arise on Killings Attributed to 2 Drifters
description: The authorities in 18 states say that nearly half the murder cases the Texas Rangers attributed to a pair of drifters are no longer considered solved.

title: NO WAY TO TREAT NEW YORK'S ASBESTOS VICTIMS
description: New York State is among a shrinking minority of states that have failed to pass a statute of limitations law that is triggered not from the moment of exposure to dangerous substances but from the point at which a victim learns of resulting complications. The distinction is important because the effects of exposure to many chemicals and toxic substances often do not show up for many years, well after the point that current laws allow victims to seek legal remedies.

title: 2 PROVE NIMBLE BUILDERS FLOATING OUTSIDE SHUTTLE
description: Leaving the security of the space shuttle Atlantis, two astronauts stepped into space today and spent much of the following five hours and 32 minutes practicing construction techniques that will be needed in building orbiting stations of the future.

title: Highwaymania
description: To the Editor:

title: CHINA REPORTED TO HAVE GOTTEN TOP U.S. SECRETS
description: A former Central Intelligence Agency analyst is thought to have given China many of the C.I.A.'s top-secret reports on the Far East over the last 20 years, an Administration official said today.

title: JOHNNY BLOOD, COLORFUL STAR OF PRO FOOTBALL, DEAD AT 82
description: John Victor McNally, the irrepressible halfback who became a legend in the National Football League in the 1930's as Johnny Blood and was one of the original 17 players inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 1963, died Thursday at Desert Hospital in Palm Springs, Calif. He was 82 years old.

title: SILICON VALLEY'S 'POOR'
description: Want to meet the new poor? Allow me to introduce myself. Despite the sports car in the driveway, the VCR in the den and the computer on my desk, I have joined this sociological subclass.

title: D.  H. HOLMES CO LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 2
description: b-Including a gain of $720,000 on the sale of properties. c-Net income.

title: Confidence in Blood-Bank Supply Is Misplaced
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. DELAYS E.E.C. STEEL IN DISPUTE WITH BRITAIN
description: The Reagan Administration today delayed entry into the United States of steel from the European Economic Community and threatened a sharp cutback next year in imports of steel pipe and tube. Both actions were meant to put pressure on Britain to ratify a Common Market-United States import restraint accord.

title: Gideon Cashman Wed To Kathryn Bachelder
description: The marriage of Kathryn L. E. Batchelder to Gideon Cashman, a senior partner in the New York law firm of Pryor, Cashman, Sherman & Flynn, took place yesterday at the Regency Hotel in New York. Judge Kevin Thomas Duffy of the United States District Court performed the ceremony.

title: GAS PISTON UTILIZED IN SPACE LAUNCHINGS
description: Apparatus that will enable a space shuttle to launch a satellite or a space probe into orbit by use of a gas piston was patented this week for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

title: UNITEL VIDEO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Net income. c-Including a tax credit of $220,000. d-Including a tax credit of $49,000. Share earnings have been adjusted to retroactively reflect a 10 percent stock dividend paid March 1, 1984.

title: Lizard in Computer Disrupts Shuttle Post
description: An 18-inch lizard disrupted operation of a computer briefly Thursday at an African ground station tracking the space shuttle Atlantis, Mission Control reported today.

title: CIRCLE FINE ART CORPORATION reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
'AIR FARCE' OFFERS CANADIAN HUMOR
description: What is the only major city in Canada whose name starts with zero?

title: SILVER INQUIRY CLEARS 2 UNITS
description: The staff of the Commodities Futures Trading Commission, after a three-year investigation, has cleared the Chicago Board of Trade and the Commodity Exchange Inc. of any wrongdoing in connection with the collapse of the silver market in 1979 and 1980, the agency said.

title: PARISIAN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 2
WORKING PROFILE: Robert J. Leonard;   SAVVY AIDE TO CHIEF OF TAX PANEL
description: The legislation on tax revision that the House Ways and Means Committee finished drafting last weekend is a monument to the extraordinary stamina and political skill of Representative Dan Rostenkowski, and when the final elements were locked into place the chairman was justifiably glowing in triumph.

title: JOYS OF HOLIDAY LEFTOVERS
description: Should anyone ever commission a study of the refrigerator in the average household, there is little doubt that immediately after Thanksgiving and perhaps Christmas, too, the door is opened and closed more than at any other time of year. Even more than the hours between the end of the school day and dinnertime in families with teen-age children.

title: AIRLINE ISSUES GAIN IN FALLING MARKET
description: Airline stocks experienced good gains yesterday, but the rest of the market was mixed in a dull session that broke with the traditional post-Thanksgiving strength.

title: CONTINENTAL FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: NORSTAN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 2
description: b-Net income.

title: TIN TALKS SET MONDAY
description: Officials from the 22 member nations of the International Tin Council begin further talks here Monday in an attempt to resolve the crisis that has paralyzed trade in the metal and left the price on the edge of collapse. Delegates said today that the session was the last opportunity for the tin council to seek a solution to the body's financial problems.

title: An Unsafe Operation
description: To the Editor:

title: LIBYA SAYS EGYPTIANS PLAN TO ATTACK
description: Libya said today that Egypt had completed a military buildup along the Egypt-Libya border and was preparing to invade after blaming Libya for the hijacking of an Egyptair jetliner last week.

title: TREATING HOLIDAY DEPRESSION
description: FOR people with great expectations about holiday parties, this can be a melancholy season. This is especially true if the season passes without living up to fond memories of it.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 30, 1985
description: International

title: Maryland Gains Title in A.C.C.
description: A 40-yard touchdown pass from Stan Gelbaugh to Ferrell Edmunds blunted a second-half comeback by Virginia today as Maryland won its third consecutive Atlantic Coast Conference championship with a a 33-21 victory.

title: Key Rates
description: * Municipal Bond Index, The Bond BuyerSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: SOME MAJOR MODERN ART LEFT UNSOLD AT AUCTIONS
description: Art collectors and dealers sat on their hands as some major contemporary artworks failed to find buyers in New York auction rooms early this month. And art-world insiders are now asking whether the works offered, the heady prices sought, or even the beginnings of a recession in the market were responsible for the dip in sales.

title: CHURCHES AND SYNAGOGUES WILL TAKE IN FAMILIES SUDDENLY LEFT HOMELESS
description: Families suddenly left homeless will be able to stay overnight this winter in churches and synagogues, rather than in ill-equipped welfare offices, under a plan being worked out between the city and a nonprofit organization.

title: TREASURY PRICES MOVE HIGHER
description: Good demand from foreign investors over the Thanksgiving holiday helped raise prices of Treasury notes and bonds as much as a half-point yesterday.

title: MEXICO BACKS DOLLAR ACCOUNT
description: Mexico will allow savers to establish dollar accounts next year for the first time since 1982, a Bank of Mexico spokesman said. The move, announced Thursday by Miguel Mancera, the director of the Bank of Mexico, will be restricted to the north, where dollar demand is strongest, and is aimed at stemming capital flight.

title: CLASSIC NUMBERS
description: For today's music lovers, the miracle of recorded sound is as mundane as their Walkman. But in the days of the Edison Home Phonograph, the turn-of-the-century equivalent to today's tape recorder, the concept of preserving sound was still a fascinating one.

title: TEXAS AMERICAN
description: An investor group led by Shamrock Associates, a Far Hills, N.J., investment partnership, said it raised its stake in Texas American Energy Corporation common stock to 446,325 shares, or 6.3 percent, of the total outstanding. The group said it had acquired 110,025 shares since Aug. 30. The Shamrock group said in September that it was considering seeking control of Texas American or seeking third parties interested in a merger or asset sale.

title: CONNECTICUT LAW ALTERS DRINKING ON CAMPUSES
description: In the three months since Connecticut raised the legal drinking age to 21, the largest impact has been on campuses and college bars, according to bartenders and students around the state.
